page.title: 09LITTLE HENNY
page.content: LITTLE HENNY IS A VERY SMALL PARISH(419ACRES) AND IN 1981 IT HAD LESS THAN 50 INHABITANTS. IT WAS DOMINATED IN THE PAST BY THE BIG HOUSE, THE RYES(SEAT OF THE BARNARDISTONS)WHICH IS NOW USED AS A SPECIAL SCHOOL FOR CHILDREN WITH HANDICAPS. IT IS A PRIVATE SCHOOL BUT PUPILS ARE PLACED THERE BY LOCAL AUTHORITIES.EXCEPT FOR THE WOODED AREA & GARDENS ROUND THE RYES THE PARISH IS LARGELY FARMING LAND. IT IS ATTRACTIVE COUNTRY TO LOOK AT & LIVE IN. THE FOUNDATIONS OF THE OLD PARISH CHURCH ARE IN THE GROUNDS OF THE RYES WITH A LITTLE OF THE WALLS SHOWING.THE BRIDLEPATH TO MIDDLETON MAKES A GOOD WALK WHERE THE RIDING PONIES HAVE NOT CHURNED UP THE WET PATCHES TOO MUCH.
